name: LavaBath&ShootingPlates-Minigames
description:
This game was developed at RMIT during 2016.2. We, Amanda Chagas and Rafael Lobo, worked together through the weeks on the course Game Design Studio 4 where we had to present one game a week. LavaBath and ShootingPlates were developed on Week11 under the theme: Minigames.

LavaBath is a 4-players game where the goal is to be last one to touch the lava by balancing or unbalancing the plataform! There are three different levels and the first player who accumulate three victorys wins.

ShootingPlates is a 2-players game where the goal is to score by shooting on the flying plates. If the player hit the center of the plate they get a higher score. By the end of the waves, the player with the highest score wins.

On both games players need to use controllers with analog sticks to play them.
